messages.message:
@Jacky Chen Could you please share the steps you followed that led to this error?
I tried reproducing it in a sandbox by adding a user with the tester role in both the review queue and the escalation queue, and it seems to be working fine.

cc @suleiman.odat would you mind help test this out in Nationwide DEV?
I tried in AIHUB MT but can't reproduce either. I know we had this issue was reported in .32 and DEV is now in .34. I am wondering if it's only in .32 or there are special setup in Nationwide that I am missing here.

Hi @Jacky Chen @Pramod Munemanik it still failed, this is the video. You will need to run the deployment with a fail that will fail validation, and the review queue (in deployment configuration) is set to a group that has Tester role in workspace

Okay, this is strange.
We don’t have checks based on specific roles. Instead, permissions are verified by the actions a user can perform. If it’s working for reviewers, it should also work for testers, since testers have all the permissions that reviewers do.
Let me set up a call so we can look into this together

I think reviewer is also going to fail, only developer or manager would work.
I had a ticket customer reported the same issue that reviewer access led to the same error.
@Pramod Munemanik roles map to role actions

Yes. Initially, I assumed the issue was only affecting tester roles, but it seems to impact reviewers, review managers, and testers as well (I’ll update this in the ticket).
It is working on AIHub MT, so the problem could be user-related. We had a similar issue (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1751893957814659) earlier where a single user’s project configuration caused the entire group to lose access to the workspace.
I’ll connect with Suleiman to investigate this further.
